licenses.description: No AI tools allowed. All work must be entirely student-generated.
licenses.syllabusText: no AI tools are permitted. All work must be entirely your own without assistance from AI tools.
licenses.example: Use this license for traditional exams, foundational skill-building exercises, and assignments where the development of specific techniques is the primary learning objective.

licenses.description: Limited AI assistance is permitted only with instructor pre-approval.
licenses.syllabusText: limited AI assistance is permitted only with instructor pre-approval. If you wish to use any AI tools, you must request permission in advance and document how they will be used.
licenses.example: Use this license for assignments that are typically expected to be completed without AI assistance, but where exceptions may be appropriate for specific students or circumstances.

licenses.description: AI tools may be used for research and ideation, but the final work must be entirely student-generated.
licenses.syllabusText: you may use AI tools for research and idea generation, but the final work must be entirely your own. You must document any AI tools used in your process.
licenses.example: Use this license for research papers, creative briefs, project planning, and assignments where AI can help with background information but the execution should demonstrate student skills.

licenses.description: AI may be used as a collaborative tool, but outputs must be significantly transformed.
licenses.syllabusText: you may use AI as a collaborative tool, but you must significantly transform and modify any AI outputs. Your work should demonstrate critical thinking and creative direction.
licenses.example: Use this license for creative writing assignments, design drafts, prototyping, and assignments where AI can assist but significant human transformation is expected.

licenses.description: AI-assisted creation is permitted with clear direction and modification from the student.
licenses.syllabusText: you may use AI-assisted creation with clear direction and modification from you. The concept, direction, and post-processing should demonstrate your creative input.
licenses.example: Use this license for visual arts, creative writing, and design assignments where AI can be used as a production tool guided by the student's creative vision.

licenses.description: AI usage is a required component of the assignment, with focus on sophisticated AI integration.
licenses.syllabusText: AI usage is a required component of this assignment. You are expected to demonstrate sophisticated use of AI tools and document your process thoroughly.
licenses.example: Use this license for assignments specifically focused on AI tools, prompt engineering exercises, AI ethics discussions, and projects where AI usage itself is a learning objective.

modifiers.description: For assignments involving substantial written content
modifiers.example: Essays, research papers, creative writing, reports, scripts, poetry

modifiers.description: For assignments involving static visual content
modifiers.example: Photography, digital illustration, graphic design, posters, data visualization
Films, animations, motion graphics, video essays, promotional videos

modifiers.description: For assignments focusing on sound design or music
modifiers.example: Music composition, podcast production, sound design, audio mixing, voice recording

modifiers.description: For assignments involving 3D modeling, animation, or virtual environments
modifiers.example: 3D modeling, game design, virtual reality, architectural visualization, character animation

modifiers.description: For assignments involving physical art media where AI might be used for planning or reference
modifiers.example: Painting, drawing, sculpture, printmaking, ceramics, textiles

modifiers.description: For assignments that span multiple media types
modifiers.example: Multimedia installations, websites, interactive experiences, transmedia projects

modifiers.description: For assignments involving programming or software development
modifiers.example: Software development, web applications, algorithms, data science scripts, computational art
